member.name: T:AwsSignatureVersion4.AwsSignatureHandler
member.summary:
HTTP message handler capable of signing requests using Signature Version 4. This class is designed to be compatible with
IHttpClientFactory and its request pipeline. For more information about message handlers and their usage, please see
HTTP Message Handlers in ASP.NET Web API.
member.remarks: Please make sure to leave the request unchanged after having it signed. Any changes in subsequent message handlers will render the signature invalid.

member.name: M:AwsSignatureVersion4.AwsSignatureHandler.#ctor(AwsSignatureVersion4.AwsSignatureHandlerSettings)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The signature settings.

member.name: M:AwsSignatureVersion4.AwsSignatureHandler.RemoveHeaders(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage)
member.summary: Given the idempotent nature of message handlers, lets remove request headers that might have been added by an prior attempt to send the request.

member.name: T:AwsSignatureVersion4.AwsSignatureHandlerSettings
member.summary: Class action as settings for .

member.name: M:AwsSignatureVersion4.AwsSignatureHandlerSettings.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Amazon.Runtime.ImmutableCredentials)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The system name of the AWS region associated with the endpoint, e.g. "us-east-1".
The signing name of the service, e.g. "execute-api".

AWS credentials containing the following parameters: - The AWS public key for the account making the service call. - The AWS secret key for the account making the call, in clear text. - The session token obtained from STS if request is authenticated using temporary security credentials, e.g. a role.

member.summary: Building the authorization header is one of the steps in the Signature Version 4 process. For more information, please read https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/sigv4-create-canonical-request.html.

member.name: P:AwsSignatureVersion4.Private.CanonicalRequest.EnvironmentProbe
member.summary: Gets or sets an instance capable of probing the environment.

member.name: P:AwsSignatureVersion4.Private.CanonicalRequest.HeaderValueSeparator
member.summary:
Gets or sets the header value separator. The default value is ", " and it is defined in
HttpHeaderParser in the .NET source code. It is used when serializing a header with multiple values into a HTTP request. For some other languages this separator is plainly ",", but Microsoft has chosen to go with ", ".

member.returns: The first value is the canonical request, the second value is the signed headers.

member.name: T:AwsSignatureVersion4.Private.ContentHash

member.name: T:System.Net.Http.DeleteAsyncExtensions
member.summary: Extensions to extending it to support DELETE requests signed with AWS Signature Version 4.

member.name: M:System.Net.Http.DeleteAsyncExtensions.DeleteAsync(System.Net.Http.HttpClient,System.String,System.String,System.String,Amazon.Runtime.AWSCredentials)
member.summary: Send a Signature Version 4 signed DELETE request to the specified Uri as an asynchronous operation.
member.param: The extension target.
The Uri the request is sent to.
The system name of the AWS region associated with the endpoint, e.g. "us-east-1".
The signing name of the service, e.g. "execute-api".

AWS credentials containing the following parameters: - The AWS public key for the account making the service call. - The AWS secret key for the account making the call, in clear text. - The session token obtained from STS if request is authenticated using temporary security credentials, e.g. a role.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.
member.exception: The is null.
The request failed due to an underlying issue such as network connectivity, DNS failure, server certificate validation or timeout.
member.remarks: This operation will not block. The returned object will complete once the entire response including content is read.
